title: BUG: selecting vault not working properly
body:
**Version (please complete the following information):**

- OS: macOS Sequoia 15.2
- Browser: Edge, Safari
- Web Clipper version: 0.10.6
- Obsidian version: 1.7.7

**Describe the bug**

Selecting the vault in the popup window (right above the interpret bar) does not work. (in both macOS Edge, Safari)

**Expected behavior**

Selecting a different vault other than the default would add the clip into the intended vault.

**URLs where the bug occurs**

Everywhere

**To reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open the clipper
2. Click on vault selection menu
3. Select a different vault other than the default one
4. Click on Add to Obsidian
5. Still the clipper adds the clip to the template's default vault

**Your template file**

I tried it on both the default and a custom template, and the error persists.
author: sub1nk1m

comments.body: is this a duplicate of #297?

Oh, it appears so. Sorry!On Jan 15, 2025, at 11:40, Steph Ango ***@***.***> wrote:﻿
is this a duplicate of #297?

—Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID: ***@***.***>

title: BUG: Interpreter stopped working with Claude only
body:
**Version (please complete the following information):**

- OS: macOS Sequoia 15.2
- Browser: Edge, Safari
- Web Clipper version: 0.10.6
- Obsidian version: 1.7.7

**Describe the bug**

With the new version 0.10.6, Claude stopped returning output to the clipper.

However, other models, including GPT-4o and Gemini 2.0 exp, do return its output to the clipper well.

When I checked my Claude API log, there are input and output tokens, appearing pretty normal as before. 

**Expected behavior**

Claude returns output to the clipper after hitting 'interpret'

**URLs where the bug occurs**

everywhere

**To reproduce**

1. Select Claude 3.5 Sonnet or Haiku as an Interpreter
2. Press 'interpret'
3. No output returns

**Your template file**

If you are using a custom template (i.e. not the Default template). Go to Web Clipper settings and click **More** → **Copy as JSON**. Paste the JSON code below.

```json
{
  "schemaVersion": "0.1.0",
  "name": "newsdb",
  "behavior": "create",
  "noteContentFormat": "{{\"You are tasked with summarizing an important English article for Korean readers who are not fluent in English. Your goal is to create an easy-to-understand summary that captures the main points of the article, provides necessary context, and highlights key facts and data. Follow these steps: 1. Summarize the main content of the article in simple, clear Korean. Focus on the most important information and key points. Aim for a summary that is about 1/3 to 1/2 the length of the original article. 2. Identify and list 3-5 key facts or pieces of data from the article. These should be the most important or striking pieces of information that are crucial for understanding the article's significance. Present these in a bulleted list in Korean. 3. Provide any necessary context that would help Korean readers better understand the article. This may include background information on the topic, explanations of cultural references, or clarifications of complex concepts. Keep this section brief but informative. 4. 화폐 금액이 언급된 경우 해당 금액을 한국 원화로 환산한 금액도 같이 표기합니다. 5. 요약 전체를 경어체(합쇼체)로 작성해주세요. 문장 끝에 '-습니다', '-니다' 등을 사용하여 정중하고 공손한 표현으로 요약해주세요. 6. Format your response as follows:  # [Insert headline here]  [Insert your Korean summary here]  - [Insert first key fact or data point in Korean]  - [Insert second key fact or data point in Korean]  - [Insert third key fact or data point in Korean]  (Add more if necessary)  [Insert additional context in Korean]\"}}",
  "properties": [
    {
      "name": "title",
      "value": "{{title}}",
      "type": "text"
    },
    {
      "name": "source",
      "value": "{{url}}",
      "type": "text"
    },
    {
      "name": "author",
      "value": "{{author|split:\\\", \\\"}}",
      "type": "multitext"
    },
    {
      "name": "published",
      "value": "{{published}}",
      "type": "date"
    },
    {
      "name": "created",
      "value": "{{date}}",
      "type": "date"
    },
    {
      "name": "description",
      "value": "{{description}}",
      "type": "text"
    },
    {
      "name": "tags",
      "value": "{{\\\"tags in English of the page (for example: politics, economy, military, science, tech) and names of most relevant peoples, countries, places, separated by comma and in PascalCase and alphanumeric only\\\"}}",
      "type": "multitext"
    }
  ],
  "triggers": [],
  "noteNameFormat": "{{\"기사 내용을 잘 나타내는 15-20자 내외의 한국어 헤드라인\"}}",
  "path": ""
}
```
author: sub1nk1m

comments.body: Can reproduce, will be fixed in the next version. Thanks for the template, that was helpful.

title: Conditionals in templates
body:
(As far as I can tell, this functionality doesn't exist yet…)

It would be useful if we could include IF/ELSE-type statements in templates similar to those available in the Obsidian Templater plugin.

For example, it would be useful to be able to indicate we wish to save only the highlights if there are any, otherwise save the entire content. The equivalent Templater syntax would go like this:

`{% if highlights %}{{highlights}}{% else %}{{content}}{% endif %}`
author: freshgruts

comments.body: This already on the roadmap, and there is an existing issue for it #170. Please search before opening new issues.
Apologies. I did search, but am a github newbie and mistakenly added my search criteria to the filter, rather than using the search box!

title: Clip option per template to save locally without starting/using obsidian
body:
**Use case:** there are many instances when I want to clip something very quickly, like just the URL of a page, or a quick plain text note to myself.
At the moment, this means Obsidian will start (if it isn't already running) and the vault to which I save will be brought to the front.
This is quite friction-y.

I know there are lots of benefits to sending the clip to Obsidian for processing, but I don't think it's always necessary.
The clipper templates themselves can include enough markdown to do lots of basic things.
Since files are saved locally, I'd like to think it'd be possible to have an option to save directly to the local drive, without starting Obsidian at all.
Ideally (at least for me), the option could be set at the clipper template level, so some template would save locally, and others would save through Obsidian itself.
author: FilSalustri

comments.body:
You can already do this using the arrow next to **Add to Obsidian** and click **Save file...** — though this has the limitation of saving to your downloads.

To save to a more specific location without opening Obsidian would involve using the file system API which introduces privacy and security risks, and also is not available on some OSes, so it's not something we plan to add.

Fair enough.
I really do appreciate the effort the Devs are putting into privacy & security, so I'm fine with it.
Thanks for the fast response.
Happy 2025!

title: Web clipper feature: option to automatically clip every page on load
body:
TL;DR - I want to browse and trust that the clipper (& interpreter) are taking notes for me.

### Use case or problem

Obsidian Web clipper is great. So great that I'd like the option to have it "clip" every website I visit automatically. 

### Proposed solution

In the Extension Settings, an option that would be default Off for privacy, but the user could select to have every page automatically clipped on page load. 

The one potential complication (which I've experienced with Hunchly) is for pages with dynamic content that doesn't change the URL. So for example, if I'm looking at the X/Twitter homepage feed, it can be tricky to tell the plugin how to add/overwrite the clip when the content changes but the URL doesn't. I think the feature would be useful even if this were too challenging to solve.

### Current workaround (optional)

I am currently evaluating Hunchly as a workaround.

I am also looking into ways I can configure Chrome to "script" Obsidian Web Clipper.

### Related feature requests (optional)

Now that the Web Clipper has Interpreter, this would be a very powerful "automatic note-taking" workflow. Basically, I just browse and trust that the clipper & interpreter are taking notes for me.
author: rawwerks

comments.body:
I don't think we should add this option for many reasons. It would require some additional permissions that I don't think are necessary. But also I don't think any changes to Web Clipper are needed for you to achieve this. What you need to do is automate triggering the "Quick clip" action.

Keep in mind that doing this will be a slow and expensive way to browse. It's probably better to build a more dedicated extension for this purpose.

ok, thanks for reviewing. 

_> "What you need to do is automate triggering the "Quick clip" action."_

any tips on how to accomplish this in chrome?

I am also interested in this functionality. It looks like the plugin is using the browser command and messages API to send the "Quick clip" action to the correct place in the plugin. 

I am very new to plugins, so it is possible I have misunderstood this, but the onMessage listener only listens for messages coming from the same extension. One potential solution would be to add a few lines of code with the onMessageExternal, which would do the same thing as the onMessage, but open up the message API so actions could be triggered by another extension.

Currently the quick clip is triggered by a keyboard shortcut, making use of the command API that allows plugins to bind a function to a keyboard shortcut. I have spent most of the day looking for a way to automate this, but I could not find anything. Injected user scripts are sandboxed, so no code based injection will properly trigger. There are also basically no tools for triggering a keyboard shortcut automatically.

@kepano, it is possible I have misunderstood this, as I am a brand new developer. I am willing to try to PR changes, but this is my first attempt at contributing to open source, so I may need a little guidance.
@rawwerks I figured out a way to trigger the plugin using puppeteer. Was able to get the functionality you are looking for to work.

@AarooneyFarr - sweet! Would you be willing to share the details? 

I'm trying to get the "browser-use" community to help me give AI access to plugins, I think it's also possible w playwright.

title: Fix: Remove `overflow: hidden` from the document body after highlighting (#254)
body:
Fix: Remove 'overflow: hidden' from document body after highlighting (#254)

## Description
This pull request fixes a bug where the `overflow: hidden` CSS rule persists on the document body after using the highlight option in the Web Clipper. This causes unintended layout issues that remain on the page even after the highlighting operation is complete.

## Environment
- OS: Reproduced on Windows 11 23H2
- Browser: Firefox 133.0
- Web Clipper version: 0.10.5
- Obsidian version: 1.7.7

## Current Solution
The current fix simply removes the `overflow: hidden` style from the document body once highlighting is complete. While this resolves the immediate issue, there may definitely be more optimal approaches 😄 

## Testing
1. Visit xing.com (or any other web page)
2. Use highlight option
3. Verify `overflow: hidden` is properly removed after highlighting finishes
4. Confirm page layout returns to normal

Fixes #254
author: SimonB97

comments.body: Thanks for your contribution... However your code is attempting to remove a `overflowHidden` class which does not exist. I cannot reproduce the issue either. Since the code in this PR doesn't do anything I am going to close it.

title: BUG: `overflow: hidden` left in the document body after highlighting
body:
**Version:**

- OS: Windows 11 23H2
- Browser: Firefox 133.0
- Web Clipper version: 0.10.5
- Obsidian version: 1.7.7

**Describe the bug**

When using the highlight option on a web page, the overflowHidden CSS rule is sometimes left on the web page's styles afterwards, which messes with the page layout.

**Expected behavior**

The overflowHidden CSS rule should be removed from the web page's styles after the highlight option is used.

**URLs where the bug occurs**

xing.com

**To reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to a web page.
2. Use the highlight option.
3. Observe that the overflowHidden CSS rule is left on the web page's styles.

**Your template file**

**Note**: Only the `noteContentFormat` is different from the default, by having the summary prompt to interpreter at the top and the `## Summary` header.

```json
{
  "schemaVersion": "0.1.0",
  "name": "Default",
  "behavior": "create",
  "noteContentFormat": "## Summary\n{{\"Summarize the webpage content concisely, capturing the main points, key arguments, conclusions, and noteworthy examples or insights. Write clearly and engagingly.\"}}\n\n{{content}}",
  "properties": [
    {
      "name": "title",
      "value": "{{title}}",
      "type": "text"
    },
    {
      "name": "source",
      "value": "{{url}}",
      "type": "text"
    },
    {
      "name": "author",
      "value": "{{author|split:\\\", \\\"|wikilink|join}}",
      "type": "multitext"
    },
    {
      "name": "published",
      "value": "{{published}}",
      "type": "date"
    },
    {
      "name": "created",
      "value": "{{date}}",
      "type": "date"
    },
    {
      "name": "description",
      "value": "{{description}}",
      "type": "text"
    },
    {
      "name": "tags",
      "value": "clippings",
      "type": "multitext"
    }
  ],
  "triggers": [],
  "noteNameFormat": "{{title}}",
  "path": "Clippings"
}
```
author: SimonB97

comments.body: There is no `overflowHidden` class injected by Web Clipper. Could it be the site itself?

title: Add option to remove empty spaces when adding to existing note
body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
So, the scenario that I try to implement is this: I have a note which only includes a table, and I would like to add specific clippings to that note, as additional rows on that table. The Web Clipper template is like 
```
| {{var1}} | {{var2}} | {{var3}} |
```
The problem with that is that when the new content gets appended to the note, there is a blank line before it, which I have to manually remove, otherwise the new entry is in the form of a paragraph instead of a table row. It would be nice if there would be an option to append data to notes while stripping out the preceding blank line, as populating tables with content from clippings could be a powerful feature. 

I would also be interested to know if there is an event that I could listen to, that gets triggered when the new clipping gets added to the note. That way, I could probably strip it myself.
author: gsarig

comments.body:
Duplicated: #219 

It cannot be done from the clipper.

title: Support for Converting ISO 8601 Durations to Human-Readable Format
body:
**Context:**

I frequently use Obsidian Web Clipper to extract information from web pages, including video metadata like duration. Many websites, such as YouTube, provide video durations in the ISO 8601 format—for example, `PT6702S` represents a duration of 6702 seconds.

Currently, the available filters (`slice`, `date`, `calc`) don't allow for an easy conversion of this ISO 8601 duration into a human-readable format like `HH:mm:ss`. Attempts to manipulate the string and parse it using the `date` filter lead to issues with time zone adjustments, causing inaccurate results.

**Feature Request:**

I propose adding a new filter or enhancing existing ones to support the conversion of ISO 8601 duration strings directly into human-readable time formats without time zone adjustments.

**Proposed Solution:**

- **New Filter (e.g., `duration`):**
  - Parses ISO 8601 duration strings and formats them according to a specified pattern.
  - Example usage: `{{schema:@VideoObject:duration|duration:"HH:mm:ss"}}` would output `01:51:42` for `PT6702S`.

**Thank you for considering this feature request!**
author: jldiaz

comments.body: Will be in 0.10.5

title: Settings Sync
body:
Would it be possible to give an automatic sync system to Obsidian Web Clipper?
If the clipper automatically saved the settings In Obsidian folders (considering the clipper is useless without Obsidian installed locally), all the clippers installed on any browser on any machine sharing the vaults could automatically sync the settings

title: unique filter for array to remove duplicates
body:
Hi, I am trying to extract a list of image urls from the meta data in header using:
`{{selector:meta[name="og:image"]?content|image}}`, and for an unknown reason, some urls are repeated twice in the header (I did some research and it seems to be related with caching mechanism). 
So I think it would be nice to have a "distinct" or "unique" filter that can be appplied on arrary to remove duplicates.
author: XU-Nuo

comments.body: Added `unique` in 0.10.3

title: BUG:  Interpreter Automatically run option has no effect
body:
**Version (please complete the following information):**

- OS: MacOS 15.1.1
- Browser Safari, Chrome
- Web Clipper version: 0.10.0
- Obsidian version: 1.7.7

**Describe the bug**

When switching automatically run option off, it still runs the llm model when clicking the "Add to Obsidian Button"

**Expected behavior**
I assumed with the option off it will only call the LLM when clicking the interpret button

**URLs where the bug occurs**

Any specific web pages where the bug can be replicated.

**To reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Switch the option off ans capture any webpage

**Your template file**

If you are using a custom template (i.e. not the Default template). Go to Web Clipper settings and click **More** → **Copy as JSON**. Paste the JSON code below.

```json
{
  "schemaVersion": "0.1.0",
  "name": "Default",
  "behavior": "create",
  "noteContentFormat": "{{\"a summary of the page in German\"|blockquote}}\n\n{{content}}\n\n---\nOrdner: `=this.file.folder`",
  "properties": [
    {
      "name": "title",
      "value": "{{title}}",
      "type": "text"
    },
    {
      "name": "source",
      "value": "{{url}}",
      "type": "text"
    },
    {
      "name": "author",
      "value": "{{author|split:\\\", \\\"|wikilink|join}}",
      "type": "multitext"
    },
    {
      "name": "published",
      "value": "{{published|date:\\\"DD.MM.YY\\\"}}",
      "type": "date"
    },
    {
      "name": "erstellt",
      "value": "{{date|date:\\\"DD.MM.YY\\\"}}",
      "type": "text"
    },
    {
      "name": "description",
      "value": "{{description}}",
      "type": "text"
    },
    {
      "name": "tags",
      "value": "clippings",
      "type": "multitext"
    },
    {
      "name": "geändert",
      "value": "{{date|date:\\\"DD.MM.YY\\\"}}",
      "type": "text"
    }
  ],
  "triggers": [],
  "noteNameFormat": "{{title}}",
  "path": "18 Clippings"
}```
author: iLeif-de

comments.body:
This is intentional. Automatically run means that it runs as soon as you open the popup.

If you don't want it to run you should use a different template without prompts.

Ok, might be a workaround. Nevertheless the UI is a little bit misleading. So the feature for non automatically is the possibility to choose a different model, which is then the only manual step in-between.

title: Sync highlights with Vault
body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
Thanks for adding the ability to save a whole web page with highlights.  

I use multiple computers to edit the same Obsidian Vault, so the fact that this extension saves a page's past highlights in the browser could cause consistency problems.  A solution could be to, instead of storing highlights in the browser, to restore the highlights from the page stored in the Obsidian vault.
author: notuntoward

comments.body: This is a duplicate of #174 and/or #111

title: Create a new note with note properties with behaviour option "Add to an existing note, at the bottom"
body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
When creating a note using Templates, I want to Clipper to (1) create a new note **with note properties** if the note doesn't exist, and (2) add to an existing note at the bottom if the note exists. At the moment, Clipper creates a new note without note properties if the note is created with a template behaviour option "Add to an existing note, at the bottom". So, I need to add note properties manually after creating the note with the behaviour option. I think it's common for users to have note properties at the top of the note for any newly created notes, so it'd be nice to have the note properties at the top as long as the note is newly created.

Most importantly, thanks for the awesome Chrome extension!
author: swoh816

comments.body: This is request should be added on the Obsidian Forum since it's an Obsidian URI request, not a Web Clipper request.

title: Safari extension option to change ⌥⌘H (typically “Hide Others [apps]” in the Safari menu) command for engaging the Highlighter
body: As the title suggests, it would be nice to have an option to change the **⌥⌘H** command to something else (as it is currently intercepted by Obsidian Webclipper to engage the page highlighter). It is the System/App-level command for hiding all other apps, which I often use in particular scenarios in Safari. I searched for this to make sure I wasn’t missing it, but alas. If so, I apologize!
author: mindfad

comments.body: Can I ask, where do you see this hotkey? The hotkey is Opt+Shift+H not CMD+Shift+H

Apologies, I didn’t realize someone already posted this!

I’m good at reading today.

I am not using shift at all. ⌥⌘H is engaging the highlighter.
To clarify, ⇧⌥H toggles on and off the highlighter, but so does ⌥⌘H in exactly the same way.
Ok it will be fixed in the next version. This is a duplicate of #139
Thank you kindly for your time and the heads up! Sorry, I missed that. I’m still getting the hang of GitHub. 😊

title: BUG: new version has unexplained mandatory permissions
body:
**Version (please complete the following information):**

- OS: Android 14
- Browser: Firefox 132.0.2
- Web Clipper version: 0.9.6
- Obsidian version: 1.7.6

**Describe the bug**

0.9.6 requires the new permission "Download files and read and modify the browser’s download history" with no explanation and no option to deny.

The permission implies that Web Clipper could download something and then hide that it has done so, which is behaviour I can't agree to in any add-on (nothing personal!).

I'd be happy to miss out on a specific feature that needs that permission (0.9.5 didn't require it, and I really enjoyed using Web Clipper for the few days I had it - it's a great tool), but I can't agree to any add-on that *requires* this permission to function.

**Expected behavior**

- New permissions should be explained.
- Permissions that affect transparency should be optional.

**URLs where the bug occurs**

N/A

**To reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install <0.9.6 via Firefox extension site.
2. Wait for "new permission required" notification from Firefox.
3. Tap "deny".
4. Goto 2.

**Your template file**

Sorry, I can't provide a template because I've uninstalled Web Clipper. It was whatever the default was.
author: brian-burton

comments.body: It has already been removed for 0.9.7
Thanks @kepano, installed 0.9.7 and all working fine.

title: BUG: Firefox Shortcut Alt + H "Get Help" interferes with Highlighter Command
body:
**Version:**

- Obsidian version: 1.7.6

**Describe the bug**

Hotkey to Activate Highlighter Mode Alt + H interferes with native "Get Help" Firefox Command. There seems to be no option to change the shortcut easily from the extension settings.

**Expected behavior**

I would like to be able to set the keyboard shortcut for activating highlighter mode and would suggest that the default shortcut not overwrite native commands which work the same in every application.

**URLs where the bug occurs**

Any webpage.

**To reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1.     Go to any website
2.     Use shortcut Alt + H to activate Highlighter Mode
3.     Toggles "Get Help" Firefox shortcut instead of activating Obsidian Clipper.
author: andibakti

comments.body: You should be able to change commands by following the instructions in the settings. What do you suggest as a command? Unfortunately there are few available mappings.
Will be changed to `Alt + Shift + H`

title: Feature Request: Copy Content with Properties to Clipboard.
body:
A small "Copy" button right beside "Add to Obsidian" would be much appreciated.

**Description:**

Currently, there's no straightforward way to copy content along with its properties (metadata) into the Obsidian vault. While it’s possible to copy the raw content, the associated properties are omitted. This makes it cumbersome to transfer fully formatted entries with all intended attributes.

**Proposed Solution:**

Add a "Copy with Properties" button that copies both the content and its properties in one action. This feature would improve workflow efficiency by allowing users to easily paste complete entries into their vault.

Thanks for considering this feature!
author: NopenAI

comments.body: It will be in the next version.
Added in 0.9.6

body: It would be useful to have an option that saves highlights appended to the full content, as a sub-heading perhaps if not as bold/decorated text inline for later retrieval.

comments.body: This is already possible using the `{{highlights}}` variable, see documentation

title: About author and published values not working
body:
Why are the author and published values not working when clipping Bilibili web pages, but they work for YouTube? I have tried several values without success:

author: This value should return the author's name.

Inputting {{author|split:", "|wikilink|join}} returns a URL.
Inputting {{meta.author|wikilink}} returns empty.
Inputting {{schema:author|wikilink}} returns empty, but it works for YouTube.
published: This value should return the video upload date rather than the update or access date.

Inputting {{published}} returns a URL.
Inputting {{date|date:YYYY-MM-DD}} returns the latest date, not the upload date.
Inputting {{schema:uploadDate|date:YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss}} returns the latest date, not the upload date, but it works for YouTube.
Inputting {{meta.uploadDate|date:YYYY-MM-DD}} returns empty.
Other attributes such as title, source, created, and tags work fine.

Browser version used: Chrome 130.0.6723.91 (Official Build) (64-bit)
author: sa-nny

comments.body:
Every website has different formatting so it is almost impossible to capture them all accurately. You can use a custom YouTube template like the one in the clipper templates repo.

{{date}} is always meant to return the current date.

Can someone help me with this? Using {{date}} works, but it's not the result I want. What value should I use to get the Bilibili video upload time? Additionally, what value should I use for the author?
Please use the Discord channel for help with templates. You can also access the YouTube template in the clipper templates repo. See readme.

title: while simple to make, include a "bookmark" clipper
body:
While simple to make the template, not every user will know how or think of how to create a template to clip the URL of a page they are viewing and save to read it later.  I think you should include in the base install a Book,ark template.  The template save the URL with page title to the end of a note.  The Note defaults to /Bookmarks or perhaps a bookmarks.md note in the default clipper folder.  Each bookmark would have [title](url) and the metadata as a callout below that, collapsed.  perhaps an option to be collapsed or not.

As always, user's can edit to place this at a different location, specify which metadata is saved, bottom or top of page and the like.

If possible allow a metadata field to specify a heading the bookmark is saved under.  If a header is specified that bottom/top of page mean top or bottom of items under that header

EDIT:  Perhaps a new behaviors would be top/bottom of bookmarks page
author: pcause

comments.body:
I am not sure I understand what you are saying. Do you mean that Web Clipper should support saving a page to the Obsidian Bookmarks plugin as opposed to saving it as a note?

If you mean saving the bookmark as a regular note, then this is already possibly by duplicating and/or modifying the default template. In the future we'll add more ways to explore and download community templates.

title: Add support for local files
body: Even when enabling "allow local files" in Edge, it is still not possible to annotate and save them.

comments.body:
+1
Clipping local files also doesn't work in Firefox.
works with the newest update! thanks a lot!
Should be fixed in 0.9.5

title: Text and Multitext in Properties
body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.

Can we stop the automatic addition of quotation marks when using Text and Multitext in Properties?
author: chliuhq

comments.body: Can you explain why?

I'm not sure what the benefit of automatically adding quotes is. I only know that when I need to use Dataview to retrieve properties, it becomes difficult because of the quotes. Perhaps adding an optional button would be more suitable?
Can you be more specific, what is the issue you are encountering in Dataview?

When I imported a web page file into Obsidian, I created a collections properties to indicate which collection the current file belongs to. This collection name is usually a file name. For example, when I input collections: [[A]], it is actually imported into Obsidian as collections: "[[A]]". When I want to retrieve files in the A file where the collections properties is A, I use the following code: WHERE contains(collections, this.file.name), but this code is actually ineffective. I don't know how to represent "[[A]]", as it seems difficult.
You have to use `this.file.link` not `this.file.name`

title: Copy to clipboard behavior
body:
Can Clipper have a "Copy to clipboard" behavior. This would be useful for inserting into the random notes that I happen to working on at any given time.  

I know I can "ctrl+A" and then "ctrl+C" on the preview but pressing the button at the bottom instead would surely save a step every time.
author: reply2za

comments.body: Can you clarify what the use case is? Have you considered using "Add to existing note" in your template?

I like to have certain notes open in Obsidian, and while doing research, place a reference to the site (in a certain format) in the note. The thing is that there isn't any one note that I would put the reference in, so creating an "add to existing note" for every note in my vault would be overkill.
This was added in 0.9.6

title: BUG: Can't override {{date}} settings in 'schema 1.0.1'
body:
**Version (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Mac
 - Browser: Chrome
 - Web Clipper version: don't know
- Obsidian version: 1.7.3

**Describe the bug**
I am trying to add a {{date}} to the note name but it seems to be overridden by 'schema 1.0.1', which I have no access to. The resulting text is `2024-10-09T21:32:03-04:00` even when I use `{{date:YYYY-MM-DD}}`. I expected a date like `2024-10-09`.
author: stoweboyd

comments.body: This is a duplicate of #40. The correct use of the date filter is `{{date|date:"YYYY-MM-DD"}}`
Thanks, that works.

title: Extract Youtube video embed code and published date
body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like a feature in Obsidian clipper where I can extract video embed code (iframe) and published date of the video. 

Thank you.
author: Missionary-OSBS

comments.body: What you're describing is possible, you can find a YouTube template in the Clipper templates repo. Please use the Discord channel to discuss templates.

title: T letter in date/time type filter
body:
I'm trying to get the "date/time" type properties of the format `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm`,
but all filter options ignore the letter T, I suspect the filter breaks when using it:

`{{schema:uploadDate|date:"YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm"}}` => `2024-09-19 18:30:00`  
(ss=00 is added, I think this is the default template when an error occurs.)

`{{schema:uploadDate|date:"YYYY-MM-DD-HH:mm"}}` => `2024-09-19-18:30`

`{{schema:uploadDate|date:"YYYY-MM-DD'T'HH:mm"}} `=> `2024-09-19'T'18:30`


The only way I've gotten it to work is to use the “text” properties type and specific template, but it adds quotation marks `" "` :
`{{time|date:"YYYY-MM-DD"}}T{{time|date:"HH:mm"}}` => `"2024-09-19T18:30"`


The source string is `schema:uploadDate` from the youtube-clipper.json template:
`2024-09-19T07:30:24-07:00`
author: hmnijp

comments.body: This will be fixed in the next update. The issue was that time type properties were being converted to `YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss`, now they will always use `'YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ` to adhere to the YAML standard. If you want a different format you may need to change the property type to `text`.

title: Since the new update, obsidian restart on mobile when the uri is sent
body:
I update the extension on my mobile browser. Since that, every time I try to clip a page, the obsidian app restart and so the page is not clipped.

I try with the Save "clipped note without opening it" option enabled and disabled and it's the same.

I didn't try with the Early access features enabled because I'm not an insider. But before the update, all worked fine.
author: MelodyDuplaix

comments.body: What browser are you using?
Simply the Firefox mobile browser.
Does the problem occur when clipping long content or regardless of content length? I would recommend using Obsidian 1.7.2+ as it sounds like this is a duplicate of #51.
No, it's occur with every page, even very small content. And the same pages worked fine before the update.
Before which update?
It worked fine with the version 0.4.8 of the extension and not with 0.5
It's very strange because I just tried with firefox nightly and It work.
This appears to have been an unknown temporary bug. I completely reinstalled Firefox and not just the extension and it now works again.

title: Suggestion: Context Menu Item
body:
Hello.

First of all, great work on the extension. It is working very well in a few tests I did.

A small suggestion would be for the extension to also have a context menu, when some text is selected.. 

My muscle memory tends to right click -> Clip when dealing with selections versus going to the extension icon, when I want to clip a full page.

It would also be consistent with other extensions I use,  like Raindrop for annotations or MarkDownload.

The menu could simply open the main extension screen (the same behavior as clicking on the extension icon).

Not a blocker of any kind and I probably can adapt. just a nice to have.

comments.body: Will be in the next update
Added to 0.5.0

title: Question: How to clip only text content and no images
body:
Hi, I'm loving the new clipper extension so far! Works flawlessly for me using Firefox v130.0 and Obsidian v1.6.7.

How is it possible to just get the **text** from `{{content}}` without **images**?

Thanks!

---

Edit, my template

```
# {{title}}
#source #clippings

**{{description}}**

{{content}}
```
author: amperag

comments.body:
Follow-Up Question:

When only clipping the text from `{{content}}`, how is it possible to just get the plain text without any markup (or markdown)?

So without any `*italic*` or `**bold**` or `# heading` or `[links]()` formatting.
Okay I added the `stripmd` filter, see readme. It will be in the next version.

> Okay I added the `stripmd` filter, see readme. It will be in the next version.

Thanks kepano, once the new version is out I'll test it!
Added to 0.4.1 which will be available when approved by the extension stores.
